TopicTitle: ExoKerbol Core Drill and Newton's 3rd Law

Articles.Content:
Hello,

I just used an Exokerbol Core Drill on Duna (from DMagic I believe, not sure if stock or not) and it flipped my lander completely - it actually sent it entirely airborne for a second. Is it supposed to push against your craft that hard? My Lander was about 2.5 tons and it was on a narrow base, but you would think if anything a drill would pull you inwards as opposed to the opposite due to the screwing force. Is this known, and if so do I just need a 10-ton class lander? 

 

I would have a picture, but trying to F9 crashed my game. I might need a reinstall lol.

Your lander shouldn't be flying into the air, no. That's probably a bug to do with improper collision detection.

Since I don't know anything about coding, your best bet is to have a downward force as you put the drill into the ground.
I would suggest posting this in DMagic's thread (it is in fact his mod, I use it too ). Can you repeat the problem? I suspect it may not happen again.
